attributes.action: Legislate the number of dogs that professional dog walkers can walk at one time
attributes.background: We want to ask the government to legislate the number of dogs that professional dog walkers are allowed to walk at any one time. To a maximum 3 dogs per each dog walker. This will be more beneficial for each dog, and the dog walker can promote responsible dog ownership/care.
attributes.additional_details: From our own personal experience we see on a daily basis dog walkers sometimes walking 4-6 dogs and more at any one time - Some of the walkers just allow the dogs to jump out of the cars in the car park area and run around out of control.  We question whether a dog walker with 4-6 dogs or more has total control for any eventuality - whether that be a pending dog fight, a dog running off or just being able to collect and dispose of their dogs poo. Logistically its practically impossible.

attributes.action: Make the day after Remembrance Sunday a Bank Holiday to honour our Armed Forces
attributes.background: The day after Remembrance Sunday should be made a Bank Holiday every year to honour Britain’s war dead and Armed Forces. Many other countries pay tribute to their Armed Forces with a national holiday including the United States, Canada, Russia, France and Israel.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of tax charged on fuel
attributes.background: Far too much excise duty is placed on fuel leading in increased costs to the consumer

attributes.action: Delay IR35 the implementation for 18 months for the NHS to implement HMRC rules
attributes.background:
IR35  regulations start 6th April, this effects 60000 Doctors and Nurses
Many Doctors and Nurses do ‘Locum/temp’ work to top up their salaries and keep the NHS working.
IR35 regulations are enforced from the 6th of April 2017, A&E , Out of Hours GP services will collapse.
attributes.additional_details:
Many Doctors and Nurses do ‘Locum/temp’ work to top up their salaries and keep the NHS working. The IR35 changes mean the loss of income will ultimately lead to them stopping working extra hours. 

Government wants 7 days a week NHS but fails to recognise the lack of Doctors to do the work, and if IR35 regulations are enforced from the 6th of April 2017, A&E ,Out of Hours GP services will collapse. The government  will state Locums are the cause they are the Elastoplast keeping it running.

attributes.action: Renationalise water.
attributes.background:
Stop investors from around the world profiting from a basic human need. 
Removing the profit margin, will reduce everyone's water bill.
attributes.additional_details: Do your own research online, form your own opinion, but when you decide renationalising water is a great idea, sign the petition!

attributes.action: Allow all motorhomes over 3500kg to be driven as cat C1
attributes.background: At the moment people with C1 on their driving license can drive a motorhome up to 7,500kg MAM. There are many coach conversions and american style RV's that go over this weight which then fall into the C category and require taking a LGV test. This should be changed as the motorhome is not a LGV.
attributes.additional_details: LGV means Larger Goods Vehicle so why does a motorhome over the weight of 7,500kg suddenly become a goods vehicle? A motorhome is not designed to carry goods and is not a commercial vehicle. It should be classified either as Cat C1 or a new category should be introduced to allow it to be driven without the need to take a goods vehicle test.

attributes.action: Debate motion of NO CONFIDENCE in "The Independent Inquiry into Child Sex Abuse"
attributes.background: The 2014 Inquiry in Child Sex Abuse has too broad a brief and is failing to show any tangible results. Crimes reported to the Police are going unpunished. Parliament must break the paralysis and free the Police to go for convictions on their strongest evidence. The people want results!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3818215/Inquiry-Westminster-child-abuse-descends-chaos-3million-spent-lawyers-wages-probe-starts.html

http://www.express.co.uk/news/politics/549704/Tens-of-thousands-could-be-victims-of-alleged-Westminster-child-abuse-senior-MP-warns

http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/769201/Tory-PM-Sir-Edward-Heath-120-per-cent-genuine-paedophile-Wiltshire-police-Veale-Saville

attributes.action: We demand that serving MPs do not have jobs within the media.
attributes.background: Recently it was announced that George Osborne MP is to take on the position of editor at the Evening Standard. We believe that our MPs' roles should come first and that positions in the media could damage the scrutiny performed by the media on our governing bodies and create bias.

attributes.action: Let NHS off £1,000 overseas immigration skills charge
attributes.background:
The charge aims to reduce Britain’s reliance on migrant workers and train British staff to fill those jobs.

For the NHS, this will mean paying millions for the thousands of non-EU doctor and nurses already working here. This is money the NHS could use to provide better health and care services.
attributes.additional_details:
Immigration Skills Charge
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/governments-new-immigration-skills-charge-to-incentivise-training-of-british-workers

BBC: Let NHS off £1,000 overseas doctors charge, urge unions
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-39249726

British Medical Association
https://www.bma.org.uk/collective-voice/influence/key-negotiations/training-and-workforce/immigration-skills-charge

attributes.action: Boycott trade with China until removal of the barbaric dog meat festival & trade
attributes.background: "The trade in dogs destined for human consumption throughout Asia, results in the suffering of tens of millions of dogs each year. All stages of the trade- sourcing, transport, sale and slaughter- result in unimaginable animal suffering" - change for animals.org

attributes.action: Stop the imposition of 'Relationships Education' on primary school children
attributes.background: The new Clause 15 of the Children and Social Work Bill will allow the Government to impose compulsory 'Relationships Education' on primary school children.  This represents a disgraceful intrusion on private family life and is a direct attack on parental responsibility.

attributes.action: Investigate the true scale of female genital mutilation within the UK.
attributes.background: Female genital mutilation is not required by any religion.It is a barbaric ancient cultural practice that exisisted before Islam, Christianity or Judaism.It serves no medical purpose and destroys young girls lives.
attributes.additional_details: Female genital mutilation is illegal in the UK and involvement in its practice can result in prosecution and a 14 year prison sentence.Despite this, thousands of cases are reported by Doctors, Hospitals, and support groups every year in the UK and yet their has not being one successful prosecution.This must be investigated.The UK should be the standard bearer to the rest of the world with a zero tolerance approach and commitment to eradicate its practice.

attributes.action: Change the law that states you have to do 3 sciences for GCSE.
attributes.background: I am a 12 year old girl. have just chosen my GCSE's and I think it is wrong that I have to do 3 sciences. I think we should change the law so it is that we have to do 2 sciences and then have the choice to do 1 more science or a different subject.
attributes.additional_details: The law currently states that GCSE students have to do all 3 sciences and the reasoning for this is that there needs to be more women in scientific jobs. This law does not help those who do not want to have a career in science. I think that the law should be changed so that GCSE students do 2 sciences and then chose either 1 more science or a different subject. This means you are not losing a GCSE or a qualification, just possibly a science.

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Main Home
attributes.background: People need to move house for many reasons, job, health, family, personal circumstances change etc. they should be able to move easily, without a financial penalty being paid to the government. But they can't because of stamp duty. It locks people in unsuitable homes and restricts movement.
attributes.additional_details: Most have to add the stamp duty tax to their mortgage. How can taking out a loan for 25-30 years to pay the government for the privilege of moving home be right. Stamp duty tax is damaging the property market, peoples lives & the economy. Many people that want to, or need to move cannot, simply because of the enormous cost of stamp duty. Stamp Duty tax needs to be abolished.

attributes.action: No child maintenance for parents refusing access without legal reason to.
attributes.background: Parents who refuse access for other parent should not be entitled to any maintenance for that child if they cannot provide legal reasons and evidence for why they are refusing access. All attempts should be made by all parties involved to resolve outside the courts whenever possible.
attributes.additional_details: The relationship I was in dissolved when my then partner fell pregnant when I was in German with the Army, so I applied for early posting back to the UK and was posted to the south but my partner lived up north, I could only afford to travel once or twice a month, my partner said it wasn't good enough. I made journeys to see my child and on arrival was refused access which left me struggling financially,  Travel £240 a month maintenance £250 wasn't feasible. I live north now and still no access.

attributes.action: Stop the scrapping of The Armed Forces Retention Bonus.
attributes.background:
After the publication of the New Employment Model across the armed forces, retention and morale has taken a critical blow.

I urge the government and MOD to rethink its strategy to revoke all commitment bonuses in 2021 in order to prevent further damage.
attributes.additional_details:
JSP 754, Part 2, Chapter 6, Section 2.

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/514120/20160330_NEM-Pay16_Booklet_Rev_300316.pdf

attributes.action: Ban smoking in all public places in the UK
attributes.background:
Why are we still breathing in smoke that we know will kill us, even when we've chosen not to?
Those of us who have decided not to smoke, or to give up, are still forced to inhale cigarette smoke every time we go for a walk or take our children to the park or pop to the shops! It's not right!
attributes.additional_details:
Smoking is the primary cause of preventable illness and premature death, accounting for approximately 96,000 deaths a year in the United Kingdom.

Smoking harms nearly every organ of the body and dramatically reduces both quality of life and life expectancy.

The 2010 US Surgeon General report, ‘How Tobacco Smoke Causes Disease’, concludes that “there is no risk-free level of exposure to tobacco smoke, and there is no safe tobacco product".

attributes.action: Apply to rejoin EFTA & retain EEA membership as objective of Art 50 negotiations
attributes.background: We call on HMG to aim for a practical workable realistic outcome in negotiations with the EU. To that end, rejoining EFTA & remaining in the EEA is the only sensible initial route. Any other approach will waste time, to the detriment of us all.

attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid payments at the beginning of the next fiscal year.
attributes.background: We need to reallocate all funds to projects within the UK, such as homeless shelters built in every city in the UK with a full time GP, medical and social care staff including drug and alcohol abuse, PTSD, catering and educational facilities and education and retraining facilities.
attributes.additional_details: That for a period of one year no foreign aid be paid and that at the end of that year, the government then uses a jury picked in the same way as the current judicial system to hear each case of requested aid from foreign countries. Furthermore that a list of qualifying criteria is put in place prior to any allocation of funds. Such as no country with a GDP higher than ours can request money, that the goverent of the country is an elected one, that the country does not have a nuclear program.

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls!
attributes.background:
Their is no need for the Severn bridge to have tolls! It is proven that they don't need it anymore. It makes 90 million and the mantence costs are 15 million...so where's the rest of the money going?! 

You don't pay to go to Scotland....so why do we have to pay to go to Wales.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 overall revenue from the tolls was over £90m, while it had been suggested that maintenance costs amounted to between £13m and £15m.

It would be a major boost for the Welsh ecomony, but it is getting held back from getting that vital boost.

attributes.action: Have a progressive capital gains tax in the U.K for high net worth individuals.
attributes.background: Only wealthy people make large gains on their assets; yet they pay the same as working people earning £11,000 to £43,000 per year; this is obviously unfair and perpetuates inequality. Let's create a fairer society where our taxes don't benefit the wealthy and everyone really pays their fair share.
attributes.additional_details:
The FTSE 100 average yearly gain is 5.4% (Motley Fool UK).  Yet average yearly earning income increases between 2001 and 2016 is just 2.3% (ONS). Clearly a CGT rate of 20% benefits the wealthy.
CGT shouldn't change for companies, only for high net worth individuals. Capital investment is essential to our economy; and individuals won't be put off investing if they have to pay 40% on their profits like everyone else. Changing CGT would improve inequality and provide revenue for the government.

attributes.action: Allow rape victims to receive forensic examination and results before reporting
attributes.background: Potential rape victims often can't find out whether they have ingested a date rape drug unless they take legal action and report the crime. This involves undergoing a 3 hour forensic examination, making a video statement, and the arrest of the accused. They may also be forced to appear in court.
attributes.additional_details: Date rape drugs leave the system within 72 hours of being ingested, and forensic examinations should be made within this time frame too, so that the victim can eat, drink and shower normally. The decision to report is heavy, and should be given time. When forced to make a decision so quickly, victims are often pressured into reporting their crimes when it isn't in their interest to do so. Victims should have the right to receive the forensic examination and its results before reporting.

attributes.action: Maintenance loans for FE students in the UK.
attributes.background: Since researching in to FE courses, I found that under 19 year olds don't get maintenance loans for this course because it is 'not an undergraduate course'. I was not told this when I applied to study a Foundation course and would like if you could join me in my views towards helping these courses.

attributes.action: Make housing affordable for everyone living in council and private accommodation
attributes.background: Renting properties whether, it be council or private are becoming more & more expensive, with the living minimum wage at £7.20ph (on average) this makes living an impossible task. More & more families are left with a decision to either pay their rent or feed their family.
attributes.additional_details: Rent costs are forever increasing yet the minimum wage isn't. with the rent increasing to the amount a mortgage would cost, families are forced to choose between feeding their family or pay the rent, with failure to pay rent, evictions have soared and so has stress and suicide. an average person on minimum wage £7.20ph 40hrs a week = £288 x 4 weeks=£1,152 - tax 20% basic rate = £960 deduct rent, minimum start £450= £510 council tax average £75pm = £435 this is what is left each month on average.

attributes.action: Help to buy for first time buyers. Govt should not charge premium on the equity.
attributes.background: Help to buy makes it difficult to remortgage the property because you have to pay premium on equity to the government. If this is help to buy then why charge premium on equity. Take you money back but let the owner keep equity so that he/she can keep the mortgage payments in control.
attributes.additional_details: Remortgage to pay equity back to govt makes payments stretched and make it difficult to run house expenses.

attributes.action: Install speed humps on roads around nursery, primary and special needs schools.
attributes.background: Too many drivers are disregarding our childrens safety by driving dangerously at speed around school premises. Increasing the risk of serious injury or the death of a child.
attributes.additional_details: Parking around schools causes mayhem and difficulties for parents  and carers with young children to cross the road. We the undersigned believe that children should be protected at all times and that speed humps near schools would prevent a serious accident being caused by slowing down impatient and reckless drivers.

attributes.action: Spend the £50 Billion assigned to HS2 on the NHS and Education instead.
attributes.background: I would think the money would have a better long term impact if spent on the NHS and Education rather than saving 20 minutes on a train journey.
attributes.additional_details: This would reverse the plans to close down regional hospitals which would benefit local economies. While the investment in education would benefit the country as a whole.

attributes.action: UK government immediately withdraw support for the Kiev regime.
attributes.background: Since 2014, when a coup occurred in Ukraine, Britain has steadily increased its military and logistical support for the regime.
attributes.additional_details:
It has been reported that the UK government has deployed 650 troops on "secret" operations in Ukraine in support of the coup regime. The Daily Mail* recently reported that the UK government is also deploying naval vessels to the Black Sea to support them. This is open hostility against the people of Donbass, who have a right to a democratic government, removed from them by the coup. 
 * http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4167612/HMS-Putin-Hunter-sends-Royal-Navy-ship-Black-Sea.html

attributes.action: Introduce periodic retention elections for the judges of the UK Supreme Court.
attributes.background: Periodic retention elections would enable Supreme Court judges to be  removed from office by popular vote if their judgements were deemed to be improper or to subvert government and the will of the people.
attributes.additional_details: Such elections are already used by the Supreme Courts of many US states to make judges accountable to the people.  Thus there is already a successful working precedent for such elections.

attributes.action: Create a new law for theft/damage of public access Life saving Equipment
attributes.background: Equipment such as Defibrillators or any lifesaving equipment. At present the law seems to be that they are only covered under simple theft act. We are now seeing more defibrillators in public; some that have been supplied by community fundraising/private donations surely they need more protection?
attributes.additional_details: A recent case; Hinckley where a man stole a defibrillator from a public box whilst a 1 man paramedic was attending to a incident, He has been arrested for theft, there have been other cases around the country. As a first aider & a volunteer responder I feel that a new law with a substantial minimum fine &/Or a prison term for theft/Damage of lifesaving equipment is needed. More public units are available & need to be protected. Potentially someone could die if the equipment is damaged or stolen.

attributes.action: capita to lose the contract for moving nhs records.
attributes.background: I suffer from MS and cannot be referred to a new MS nurse because my record have not reached my new GP after 3 months and some have to wait 6 months+, its not safe.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage to 8 pounds per hour
attributes.background: The minimum wage is 7.20 an hour for over 25 year old this is a joke...company directors share holders and the rich are getting ever richer off the backs of the poor it's shamefull that in this country the top 1 percent have over 90 percent of the wealth..

attributes.action: Allow all those who didn't or couldn't vote in the EU Referendum a second vote
attributes.background: Just less than 28% of registered Britain's did not vote in the June EU referendum, leave's margin of victory was 1,269,501 votes, that means 13 million potential voters for whatever reason, did not participate, they should be given the democratic right to a vote to verify the referendum outcome.

attributes.action: The public right of navigation on all rivers in the England and Wales
attributes.background: I would like parliment to allow public use of rivers and canals in England and Wales for small manually propelled vessels with a crew of up to 3 persons.
attributes.additional_details: In England and Wales there is less than 4% of the 41,000 miles (68,000km) of rivers have public access.

attributes.action: Condemn the disgraceful and dangerous actions of Donald Trump
attributes.background:
Cancelling affordable healthcare for people with long term conditions, possibly at risk of their lives.
Denying entry to the US to people with a legal right to be there. 
Removing federal funding from any organisation that offers abortion advice - even for victims of rape.

And much more
attributes.additional_details:
Also

Condoning sexual misconduct.
Presenting ‘alternative facts’ or ‘lies’ as the rest of us call them.
Removing federal funding from any organisation that offers abortion advice - even for victims of rape.
Ordering the removal of climate change information from government web sites.

And probably more, news is breaking faster than I can type.

http://www.newstatesman.com/world/2017/01/here-are-23-terrifying-things-president-trump-has-done-last-seven-days

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to approve Nivolumab for lung cancer patients
attributes.background: Denied by Nice in England and Wales, this drug is freely available in Scotland. This drug could help cure patients suffering from Lung cancer, yet the government won't allow its use. Sign today lets start changing this disgrace immediately

attributes.action: Make the police buy cars that are made in the UK and stop buying premium brands.
attributes.background: The UK has a large number of people employed in the automotive industry,  buying UK built cars helps secure UK jobs,  there is no need for the police to have  expensive BMW imported cars and Jaguar premium brand UK cars when a Vauxhall for example make a cheaper alternative that is made in the UK.

attributes.action: Regulate to ensure all rental properties are toxic mould and fungus free
attributes.background: Many of us are living in rented accommodation unfit for habitation. Toxic mould and fungus are lethal and nobody should be in that environment. I believe it is a breach of our human rights and breaks rules set out in our tenancy agreements, yet we are helpless and move from one place to the next.
attributes.additional_details: It sounds bizarre but nobody is regulating this. I'm not talking about a bit of condensation, I'm talking about when the building you live in is rotten. I'm talking about the landlords that paint over various toxic mould and damp problems to move a new tenant in so months later a jungle of danger grows back through, all the while a network of fungus roots start to form beneath the floor and then you have mushrooms sprouting. Tough regulation and penalties are needed to stop estate agents, landlords, freeholders, from making us ill.

attributes.action: Ban pheasant shooting - a cruel, senseless 'sport'.
attributes.background: Living in the countryside, we sadly witness repeated pheasant shoots taking place right before our eyes. Despite what they say, the pheasants more often than not die in a slow, painful manner often landing in our garden whilst still alive, in agony, dying slowly.This so-called 'sport' needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Repeated pheasant shoots take place across the UK, but I am speaking from personal experience of it happening in North Lincolnshire, more often than not without any prior notice given.

The pheasants are bred, released into the surrounding area, then shot repeatedly by people who enjoy killing animals for fun.

The pheasants are often mauled while still alive by dogs and/or write in agony as they land on the ground.

This is inhumane and needs to be stopped as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to deny estranged parents to be denied access to kids
attributes.background: It should be law that the estranged partner, be automatically allowed access to their children. If they truly pose a risk to them, the onus should be with the partner the children reside with to go to court prove why they feel it is not in the children's best interest to see the other parent.
attributes.additional_details: This mainly affects estranged Fathers, and now there is no legal aide for family matters, and the fact CSA take up to 40% of their wage for maintainence that they have to pay despite them being denied any kind of relationship with their children, a lot of Fathers can't afford to go to court. This is not equality!! If the children are young they can't express their needs, the law needs to ensure they do not suffer. We have enough childhood Depression. We need to put the children first.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to show ID for age restricted products being purchased
attributes.background: Retail workers are fed up of being yelled at unfairly for following procedure when requesting ID for age restricted goods. They are at risk whenever a sale goes through. NO ID = NO SALE means a drastic reduction in this risk, and the onus is on consumers - NOT retail workers.
attributes.additional_details: I'm a retail worker. The very day i started this petition, i had been yelled at by a customer for requesting ID in order to ensure i could process the sale of Vodka. DVDs, Video Games, Fireworks, Knives. NO ID = NO SALE means the cashier is no longer at risk, has confidence to check ID without fear of intimidation and consequence,  put's the onus on the customer to ensure they have ID. This simple change would help prevent under age sales, knife crime, and give everyone confidence in the system.

attributes.action: Stop all chain supermarkets selling eggs from battery and barn hens by 2018
attributes.background: We read about the poor conditions that some animals live in and want to end the cruelty. Chickens are a start to achieving our goal because the effects gained from this would be most beneficial.
attributes.additional_details: There are already systems being put into place by some stores, but these aren't expected to come into action for several years. We think that this change should happen quicker so that there is no more unnecessary suffering in the egg industry. We hope that by doing this the supermarkets will eventually eliminate all products that leave animals in terrible, cruel and inhumane situations.

attributes.action: More of the foreign aid budget should be funded towards WASH Projects globally.
attributes.background: Priti Patel, the Secretary of State for International Development said British aid money had previously been wasted and stolen. Funds as such could have been used towards Water And Sanitation Hygiene Projects; which would work towards the Global Goal 6, ensuring the availability of water to everyone
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government provide 0.7% of the Gross National Income to International aid. Most of this money is spent on educating children, immunisation, refugees and encouraging global action on climate change. However the water crisis is a significantly problematic issue, as 1 in 9 people do not have access to clean water and adequate sanitation, which kills 5,000 children daily.This leads to a lack of education and rapid spread of diseases, forcing families to fall further into extreme poverty.

attributes.action: Make Bioptic Lenses acceptable for achieving the eyesight standard for driving.
attributes.background: Bioptic Lenses are small optical scopes, that are mounted onto the spectacle frame, to help people with sight loss see extra detail in distant objects or texts. Often used to assist visually impaired individuals that still have a functional level of vision to complete everyday tasks such as driving.
attributes.additional_details: Bioptic driving began over 30 years ago in the US and is currently accepted in over 37 states as well as several European Countries, for both car and motorcycle licenses.  Current UK standards for driving have taken away the freedom and independence of thousands of individuals that would otherwise pose no additional risk to road users.  Consideration, in particular, should be given to those with stable non-progressive visual disorders, where Bioptics would allow them to meet the vision standard.

attributes.action: Ban all forms of Cold Calling In All Areas Of The UK
attributes.background: We the people of the United Kingdom would like to petition the UK Government to place a ban on all forms of cold calling in all areas of the UK (England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland).
attributes.additional_details:
People across the UK regularly receive cold calls through a number of methods... door to door, telephone etc from sales, PPi and many more. It is believed that a lot of people find this to be anti social and crime related to cold calling would appear to be on the rise, especially with the elderly, people with mental health issues and people at risk.

Door to door cold calling can be unsettling & telephone cold calling can be a nuisance as opt out services such as TPS don't seem to work.

attributes.action: Our borders are non-negotiable. The borders must be secured.
attributes.background: Any negotiation with any other nations or organisations must accept that our borders are going to be, and will remain, secured. Open borders are not an option for this or any later government.

attributes.action: Bring forward the review for the capping of elderly care costs immediately
attributes.background: The review of capping care costs meant for  2016 is delayed until 2020. Many elderly people who self-fund use all their savings including proceeds from their houses. Additionally, self-funders have no guarantee of remaining in a care home of their choosing when their assets reduce to £23.000

attributes.action: Launch a national campaign promoting the health benefits of a vegan lifestyle
attributes.background: For the UK Government to promote a Vegan lifestyle detailing the health benefits to humans, animals & the planet by either full veganism or partial. It has be shown that just changing 1 day a week to a vegan diet or just changing your type of milk can massively benefit our health and the 🌎 planet
attributes.additional_details: A Vegan lifestyle has been shown to be highly beneficial to humans, animals and and the environment whilst also saving much needed funds by the Government due to the health benefits.

attributes.action: Stop the ban on NHS staff doing agency work.
attributes.background: We need the extra cash to help us live, it's our choice to work extra and we should have a right to choose who we work for.

attributes.action: Support the 2022 Commonwealth Games bid in either Liverpool or Birmingham
attributes.background: In March 2017 Durban were stripped of the Commonwealth Games in 2022. Following that decision Liverpool and Birmingham have stepped in to say they could host the event. following the massive success of London 2012 and Glasgow 2014 I urge the UK Government to get fully behind support for this bid.
